items.title: üò≠üò≠ Los Mocochetes  we're not crying, you're...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

üò≠üò≠ Los Mocochetes we're not crying, you're crying!!!

"A little gift from your favorite Mocosos! Here‚Äôs a song we‚Äôve been working on especially for this Holiday season. As we feast and enjoy from the warmth of our families take a moment to remember that there are still kids in cages, families who have been divided and broken. And all they wish on this night is freedom; the opportunity to be a family once again. Our battle is far from over we shall not stop untill they are all... free! Tear down these walls! There is no freedom without freedom for all!"

https://youtu.be/HHdQVGvRK2I

#AbolishICE #AchristmascoldasICE #chingalamigra #freethemall

A Christmas as Cold as I.C.E

items.title: Please join the Denver Communists this New Year's Eve as we...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

Please join the Denver Communists this New Year's Eve as we join with other autonomous anarchists & activists across the Colorado Front Range in solidarity with our incarcerated neighbors & political prisoners like anarchist, activist, and poet, Eric King.

What better way is there to show solidarity other than showing up, making some noise & closing out this shit show of a year together? Show up with your best NYE noise makers, demonstration banners and signs. Who knows, we ...may even try out a new flavor of üê∑. FED or Jeffco anyone?

We are planning on meeting up at Harriman Lake Park @ 7:30 pm and heading to the facility which is @ 9595 W Quincy Ave Littleton, CO 80123

**Neither we, nor the organizers of this action, are affiliated in any way with Eric King nor the Eric King Support team @SupportEricKing. They just want to show some love and and we are happy to signal boost that!**

See More

HAPPENING NOW

Abolish Prisons: New Year‚Äôs Eve Noise Demo

Harriman Lake Park

¬∑ Littleton77 people interested

Sterling Correctional Facility has seen the worst outbreak of Colorado‚Äôs prisons. More than 1,300 inmates there have caught the virus, 10 of whom have died.

items.title: From a local Denver librarian:
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

From a local Denver librarian:

When thinking about what incarcerated people need, perhaps a library is not the first thing that comes to mind. However, the population within prison walls is typically one that reads more than those on the outside.

items.title: "Jahanian, who works at the Meyer Law Office, testified...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Jahanian, who works at the Meyer Law Office, testified that the ordinance wouldn't affect the Aurora Police Department's ability to assist federal immigration authorities with criminal law enforcement, but would only restrict the department's cooperation when it comes to civil immigration enforcement. Denver has a similar policy on the books.

The ordinance also called for prohibiting ICE officers from entering city-owned or -operated buildings for an immigration investigatio...n without a warrant signed by a judge. And it sought to prevent the City of Aurora from entering into any contracts with ICE that would deputize city employees to work on immigration enforcement.

Finally, the ordinance would have codified an unwritten policy that instructs city employees, particularly police officers, to not ask for immigration information.

Three councilmembers who spoke against the proposal repeatedly characterized it as an attempt to turn Aurora into a "sanctuary city."

See MoreThe proposal would have limited the city's cooperation with ICE.

westword.com

Aurora Council Rejects Undocumented Immigrant Protection Ordinance

The proposal would have limited the city's cooperation with ICE.The proposal would have limited the city's cooperation with ICE.

items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

From Casa de paz Please watch this short video inviting you to our memorial service to honor the lives of immigrants who have perished along the US/Mexico border in 2020.

Find more info about our memorial service and the Zoom link here: https://www.casadepazcolorado.org/‚Ä¶/the-longest-night-of-th‚Ä¶

A big thank you to Rocky Mountain PBS for sharing this story and encouraging folks to attend the service.

Casa de Paz offers shelter and support to immigrants in Colorado. This winter solstice, they are remembering the lives of people who passed away trying to make it to America.

rmpbs.org

Colorado nonprofit honors the memory of immigrants who died trying to cross the border in 2020

items.title: "One of the policies the families were subjected to was the...
items.content_html:
Abolish ICE Denver

"One of the policies the families were subjected to was the asylum transit ban, which required immigrants to first seek protection in another country through which they traveled before asking for refuge in the US. In July, the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals also blocked the rule, but the ruling didn't help any of the thousands of immigrants, like these families, who had already been subjected to the transit ban.

Under the transit ban policy, those who crossed through a third co...untry, such as Mexico or Guatemala, before arriving at the US southern border were denied asylum during their credible fear interviews, an initial step in the asylum process. After being denied the chance to be screened for asylum, these children and their families were subjected to expedited removal, which allows the government to deport undocumented immigrants without a hearing in front of an immigration judge.Federal courts have said they don't have the authority to weigh in on expedited removals. As a result, judges can't stop the deportation of these families, even though they've found that the policies leading to their deportations are illegal."

See More"These are refugees who are being sent back to the same situation they fled from," an immigration attorney told BuzzFeed News.

buzzfeednews.com

Immigrant Families Are Being Deported Without Their Asylum Claims Heard Lawfully, Advocates Say

"These are refugees who are being sent back to the same situation they fled from," an immigration attorney told BuzzFeed News."These are refugees who are being sent back to the same situation they fled from," an immigration attorney told BuzzFeed News.
